alert.note: Alert for Conway; Johnson; Logan; Newton; Pope; Searcy; Van Buren; Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 22 at 2:56AM CST until February 22 at 3:30AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Logan County in western Arkansas... Southeastern Johnson County in western Arkansas... Southwestern Searcy County in north central Arkansas... Southeastern Newton County in north central Arkansas... Northwestern Van Buren County in north central Arkansas... North central Conway County in central Arkansas... Northeastern Yell County in central Arkansas... Pope County in central Arkansas... * Until 330 AM CST. * At 256 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Moore to London, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Russellville... Atkins... Dover... London... Hector... Happy Bend... Broomfield... Dabney... Hattieville... Solo... Smyrna... Jerusalem... Woolum... Taral... Lake Dardanelle... Appleton... Ben Hur... Alread... Brock Creek Campground... Rupert... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 70 and 86, and between mile markers 93 and 100. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for central, western and north central Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for central, western and north central Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Conway; Johnson; Logan; Newton; Pope; Searcy; Van Buren; Yell
